card.name: Abbot of Keral Keep
card.ability: Prowess (Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, this creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)\nWhen Abbot of Keral Keep enters the battlefield, exile the top card of your library. Until end of turn, you may play that card.

card.name: Acolyte of the Inferno
card.ability: Renown 1 (When this creature deals combat damage to a player, if it isn't renowned, put a +1/+1 counter on it and it becomes renowned.)\nWhenever Acolyte of the Inferno becomes blocked by a creature, it deals 2 damage to that creature.

card.name: Act of Treason
card.ability: Gain control of target creature until end of turn. Untap that creature. It gains haste until end of turn. (It can attack and {T} this turn.)
card.flavor: She learned a tragic lesson that day: even the purest can be corrupted when the heart's emotions are twisted.
card.ruling:
10/1/2009 : Act of Treason can target any creature, even one that's untapped or one you already control. 
8/15/2010 : Gaining control of a creature doesn't cause you to gain control of any Auras or Equipment attached to it. 
7/1/2013 : If you control a legendary creature and gain control of another legendary creature with the same name, you’ll choose one to remain on the battlefield and put the other into its owner’s graveyard.

card.name: Aerial Volley
card.ability: Aerial Volley deals 3 damage divided as you choose among one, two, or three target creatures with flying.
card.flavor: Drakes can swerve to avoid a single arrow, but they can't dodge the whole sky.

card.name: Akroan Jailer
card.ability: {2}{W}, {T}: Tap target creature.
card.flavor: He ensures escape attempts are just that—attempts.

card.name: Akroan Sergeant
card.ability: First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)\nRenown 1 (When this creature deals combat damage to a player, if it isn't renowned, put a +1/+1 counter on it and it becomes renowned.)

card.name: Alchemist's Vial
card.ability: When Alchemist's Vial enters the battlefield, draw a card.\n{1}, {T}, Sacrifice Alchemist's Vial: Target creature can't attack or block this turn.
card.flavor: A weapon best suited for those with good aim and steady hands.

card.name: Alhammarret, High Arbiter
card.ability: Flying\nAs Alhammarret, High Arbiter enters the battlefield, each opponent reveals his or her hand. You choose the name of a nonland card revealed this way.\nYour opponents can't cast spells with the chosen name (as long as this creature is on the battlefield).

card.name: Alhammarret's Archive
card.ability: If you would gain life, you gain twice that much life instead.\nIf you would draw a card except the first one you draw in each of your draw steps, draw two cards instead.
card.flavor: It contains the totality of Alhammarret's notes, theories, and ponderings.

card.name: Ampryn Tactician
card.ability: When Ampryn Tactician enters the battlefield, creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.
card.flavor: "It's all a game. You shouldn't get too attached to the pieces."

card.name: Anchor to the Æther
card.ability: Put target creature on top of its owner's library. Scry 1. (Look at the top card of your library. You may put that card on the bottom of your library.)

card.name: Angel's Tomb
card.ability: Whenever a creature enters the battlefield under your control, you may have Angel's Tomb become a 3/3 white Angel artifact creature with flying until end of turn.
card.flavor: "Faith can quicken the stones themselves with life."—Writings of Mikaeus
card.ruling: \n5/1/2012 : If Angel's Tomb is already a creature when a creature enters the battlefield, its ability will override any effects that set its power and toughness to specific values, but other changes to its power and toughness will still apply.

card.name: Animist's Awakening
card.ability: Reveal the top X cards of your library. Put all land cards from among them onto the battlefield tapped and the rest on the bottom of your library in a random order.\nSpell mastery — If there are two or more instant and/or sorcery cards in your graveyard, untap those lands.

card.name: Anointer of Champions
card.ability: {T}: Target attacking creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
card.flavor: "Arise. You have been anointed by the light. Go forth and fight without fear, for you shall be victorious."

card.name: Archangel of Tithes
card.ability: Flying\nAs long as Archangel of Tithes is untapped, creatures can't attack you or a planeswalker you control unless their controller pays {1} for each of those creatures.\nAs long as Archangel of Tithes is attacking, creatures can't block unless their controller pays {1} for each of those creatures.

card.name: Artificer's Epiphany
card.ability: Draw two cards. If you control no artifacts, discard a card.
card.flavor: The artificers of Kaladesh strive ceaselessly for perfection, progress, and the ultimate expression of elegance.

card.name: Aspiring Aeronaut
card.ability: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)\nWhen Aspiring Aeronaut enters the battlefield, put a 1/1 colorless Thopter artifact creature token with flying onto the battlefield.

card.name: Auramancer
card.ability: When Auramancer enters the battlefield, you may return target enchantment card from your graveyard to your hand.
card.flavor: "In memories, we can find our deepest reserves of strength."

card.name: Avaricious Dragon
card.ability: Flying\nAt the beginning of your draw step, draw an additional card.\nAt the beginning of your end step, discard your hand.
card.flavor: Waste follows want.

card.name: Aven Battle Priest
card.ability: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)\nWhen Aven Battle Priest enters the battlefield, you gain 3 life.
card.flavor: When the shadow of the aven falls across the battlefield, hope rises in the hearts of the soldiers.

card.name: Battlefield Forge
card.ability: {T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.\n{T}: Add {R} or {W} to your mana pool. Battlefield Forge deals 1 damage to you.

card.name: Bellows Lizard
card.ability: {1}{R}: Bellows Lizard gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
card.flavor: As the price of wood and coal rose, smiths found creative ways to keep their forges burning.

card.name: Blazing Hellhound
card.ability: {1}, Sacrifice another creature: Blazing Hellhound deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
card.flavor: It tears the flesh from your bones and then swallows the ash with its fiery maw.

card.name: Blessed Spirits
card.ability: Flying\nWhenever you cast an enchantment spell, put a +1/+1 counter on Blessed Spirits.
card.flavor: Not all heroes die in armor.

card.name: Blightcaster
card.ability: Whenever you cast an enchantment spell, you may have target creature get -2/-2 until end of turn.
card.flavor: "Your flesh is unprepared for my gifts."
card.ruling: \n7/1/2013 : Blightcaster’s ability will resolve before the enchantment spell that caused it to trigger. \n7/1/2013 : If you are the only player who controls a creature when Blightcaster’s ability triggers, you must choose one as the target, although you can choose not to give it -2/-2.

card.name: Blood-Cursed Knight
card.ability: As long as you control an enchantment, Blood-Cursed Knight gets +1/+1 and has lifelink. (Damage dealt by this creature also causes you to gain that much life.)
card.flavor: "The bloodlust shall not control me, for my oath is my greatest compulsion."

card.name: Boggart Brute
card.ability: Menace (This creature can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.)
card.flavor: He has the biggest bashing stick, so it's a safe bet he's the leader.

card.name: Bonded Construct
card.ability: Bonded Construct can't attack alone.
card.flavor: Loyal to a fault, it heeds its master's every command.

card.name: Bone to Ash
card.ability: Counter target creature spell.\nDraw a card.
card.flavor: "I can think of worse ways to go. On second thought, maybe not."—Ludevic, necro-alchemist
card.ruling: \n1/22/2011 : If the creature spell is an illegal target (because it's left the stack, for example) when Bone to Ash tries to resolve, Bone to Ash will be countered and none of its effects will happen. You won't draw a card. \n1/22/2011 : A creature spell that can't be countered by spells and abilities is a legal target for Bone to Ash. The creature spell won't be countered when Bone to Ash resolves, but you'll still draw a card.

card.name: Bounding Krasis
card.ability: Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)\nWhen Bounding Krasis enters the battlefield, you may tap or untap target creature.
card.flavor: Unpredictable as a storm and destructive as a tidal wave.

card.name: Brawler's Plate
card.ability: Equipped creature gets +2/+2 and has trample. (It can deal excess combat damage to defending player or planeswalker while attacking.)\nEquip {4} ({4}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)

card.name: Calculated Dismissal
card.ability: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {3}.\nSpell mastery — If there are two or more instant and/or sorcery cards in your graveyard, scry 2. (To scry 2, look at the top two cards of your library, then put any number of them on the bottom of your library and the rest on top in any order.)

card.name: Call of the Full Moon
card.ability: Enchant creature\nEnchanted creature gets +3/+2 and has trample. (It can deal excess combat damage to defending player or planeswalker while attacking.)\nAt the beginning of each upkeep, if a player cast two or more spells last turn, sacrifice Call of the Full Moon.

card.name: Catacomb Slug
card.flavor: "The entire murder scene was covered in dripping, oozing slime. No need for a soothsayer to solve that one."—Pel Javya, Wojek investigator

card.name: Caustic Caterpillar
card.ability: {1}{G}, Sacrifice Caustic Caterpillar: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.
card.flavor: "The rare and beautiful butterflies inspire the design of our thopters. The larvae, however, are a different story entirely."—Kiran Nalaar, Ghirapur inventor

card.name: Caves of Koilos
card.ability: {T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.\n{T}: Add {W} or {B} to your mana pool. Caves of Koilos deals 1 damage to you.

card.name: Celestial Flare
card.ability: Target player sacrifices an attacking or blocking creature.
card.flavor: "You were defeated the moment you declared your aggression."—Gideon Jura
card.ruling:
7/1/2013 : Celestial Flare targets only a player, not any creature. A creature with hexproof or protection from white can be sacrificed this way. 
7/1/2013 : If the player sacrifices a blocking creature, any attacking creature it was blocking remains blocked. Unless that attacking creature has trample or is being blocked by another creature, it won’t assign or deal combat damage. 
7/1/2013 : Creatures continue to be attacking or blocking creatures through the end of combat step. It is possible to cast Celestial Flare within combat but after combat damage is dealt (specifically, during the combat damage step or the end of combat step). Only attacking and blocking creatures that survived combat damage can be sacrificed at this time.

card.name: Chandra, Fire of Kaladesh
card.ability: Whenever you cast a red spell, untap Chandra, Fire of Kaladesh.\n{T}: Chandra, Fire of Kaladesh deals 1 damage to target player. If Chandra has dealt 3 or more damage this turn, exile her, then return her to the battlefield transformed under her owner's control.

card.name: Chandra, Roaring Flame
card.ability: Whenever you cast a red spell, untap Chandra, Fire of Kaladesh.\n{T}: Chandra, Fire of Kaladesh deals 1 damage to target player. If Chandra has dealt 3 or more damage this turn, exile her, then return her to the battlefield transformed under her owner's control.

card.name: Chandra's Fury
card.ability: Chandra's Fury deals 4 damage to target player and 1 damage to each creature that player controls.
card.flavor: "They started it."
card.ruling: \n7/1/2012 : Chandra's Fury targets only the player, not any creature. Chandra's Fury will deal 1 damage to a creature with hexproof, for example.

card.name: Chandra's Ignition
card.ability: Target creature you control deals damage equal to its power to each other creature and each opponent.
card.flavor: In the moment before her execution, she realized what it meant to be a pyromancer, to be alive, to be Chandra.

card.name: Charging Griffin
card.ability: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)\nWhenever Charging Griffin attacks, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
card.flavor: Four claws, two wings, one beak, no fear.

card.name: Chief of the Foundry
card.ability: Other artifact creatures you control get +1/+1.
card.flavor: The foundries of Kaladesh run like clockwork under the supervision of their formidable overseers.

card.name: Citadel Castellan
card.ability: Vigilance (Attacking doesn't cause this creature to tap.)\nRenown 2 (When this creature deals combat damage to a player, if it isn't renowned, put two +1/+1 counters on it and it becomes renowned.)
card.flavor: "I am the first line of defense. You will not encounter the second."

card.name: Clash of Wills
card.ability: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {X}.
card.flavor: Alhammarret rose to his feet, and the full force of his mind hit Jace like a storm front.

card.name: Claustrophobia
card.ability: Enchant creature\nWhen Claustrophobia enters the battlefield, tap enchanted creature.\nEnchanted creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.
card.flavor: Six feet of earth muffled his cries.
card.ruling: \n9/22/2011 : Claustrophobia can target and enchant an untapped creature. \n9/22/2011 : The enchanted creature can still be untapped in other ways, such as by Village Bell-Ringer's ability.

card.name: Cleric of the Forward Order
card.ability: When Cleric of the Forward Order enters the battlefield, you gain 2 life for each creature you control named Cleric of the Forward Order.
card.flavor: War after war, a healer's enemy is always the same—death itself.

card.name: Cobblebrute
card.flavor: Ravnica's most ancient streets take on a life of their own. A few have decided to move to nicer neighborhoods.

card.name: Conclave Naturalists
card.ability: When Conclave Naturalists enters the battlefield, you may destroy target artifact or enchantment.
card.flavor: "Your swords and wards have no power here."

card.name: Consecrated by Blood
card.ability: Enchant creature\nEnchanted creature gets +2/+2 and has flying and "Sacrifice two other creatures: Regenerate this creature." (The next time the creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)

card.name: Consul's Lieutenant
card.ability: First strike\nRenown 1 (When this creature deals combat damage to a player, if it isn't renowned, put a +1/+1 counter on it and it becomes renowned.)\nWhenever Consul's Lieutenant attacks, if it's renowned, other attacking creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.

card.name: Cruel Revival
card.ability: Destroy target non-Zombie creature. It can't be regenerated. Return up to one target Zombie card from your graveyard to your hand.
card.flavor: On Innistrad, Liliana embraced necromancy, honing her powers by practicing on scores of undead—and sometimes the living.

card.name: Dark Dabbling
card.ability: Regenerate target creature. Draw a card. (The next time the creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)\nSpell mastery — If there are two or more instant and/or sorcery cards in your graveyard, also regenerate each other creature you control.

card.name: Dark Petition
card.ability: Search your library for a card and put that card into your hand. Then shuffle your library.\nSpell mastery — If there are two or more instant and/or sorcery cards in your graveyard, add {B}{B}{B} to your mana pool.

card.name: Day's Undoing
card.ability: Each player shuffles his or her hand and graveyard into his or her library, then draws seven cards. If it's your turn, end the turn. (Exile all spells and abilities on the stack, including this card. Discard down to your maximum hand size. Damage wears off, and "this turn" and "until end of turn" effects end.)

card.name: Deadbridge Shaman
card.ability: When Deadbridge Shaman dies, target opponent discards a card.
card.flavor: Ending her life won't end the infestation.

card.name: Deep-Sea Terror
card.ability: Deep-Sea Terror can't attack unless there are seven or more cards in your graveyard.
card.flavor: After stripping the sunken ships, it rises to the surface for another helping.

card.name: Demolish
card.ability: Destroy target artifact or land.
card.flavor: Nothing of nature nor of mortals can stand forever.

card.name: Demonic Pact
card.ability:
At the beginning of your upkeep, choose one that hasn't been chosen —
• Demonic Pact deals 4 damage to target creature or player and you gain 4 life.
• Target opponent discards two cards.
• Draw two cards.
• You lose the game.

card.name: Despoiler of Souls
card.ability: Despoiler of Souls can't block.\n{B}{B}, Exile two other creature cards from your graveyard: Return Despoiler of Souls from your graveyard to the battlefield.
card.flavor: Rats and vultures devour. It desecrates.

card.name: Disciple of the Ring
card.ability:
{1}, Exile an instant or sorcery card from your graveyard: Choose one —
• Counter target noncreature spell unless its controller pays {2}.
• Disciple of the Ring gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
• Tap target creature.
• Untap target creature.

card.name: Disperse
card.ability: Return target nonland permanent to its owner's hand.
card.flavor: It's pointless to hold on when you have nothing to hold on with.

card.name: Displacement Wave
card.ability: Return all nonland permanents with converted mana cost X or less to their owners' hands.
card.flavor: The sea respects no boundaries, least of all the coast.

card.name: Dragon Fodder
card.ability: Put two 1/1 red Goblin creature tokens onto the battlefield.
card.flavor: Goblins journey to the sacrificial peaks in pairs so that the rare survivor might be able to relate the details of the other's grisly demise.

card.name: Dreadwaters
card.ability: Target player puts the top X cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard, where X is the number of lands you control.
card.flavor: Stray into the Morkrut and it may rise to claim you.
card.ruling: \n5/1/2012 : The number of cards put into the graveyard is based on the number of lands you control when Dreadwaters resolves.

card.name: Dwynen, Gilt-Leaf Daen
card.ability: Reach\nOther Elf creatures you control get +1/+1.\nWhenever Dwynen, Gilt-Leaf Daen attacks, you gain 1 life for each attacking Elf you control.
card.flavor: "This is our land. We will not allow eyeblights to poison its beauty."

card.name: Dwynen's Elite
card.ability: When Dwynen's Elite enters the battlefield, if you control another Elf, put a 1/1 green Elf Warrior creature token onto the battlefield.
card.flavor: "Come, my beautiful brothers and sisters. Let us hunt."—Dwynen, Gilt-Leaf daen

card.name: Elemental Bond
card.ability: Whenever a creature with power 3 or greater enters the battlefield under your control, draw a card.
card.flavor: "I want to help Zendikar. Show me the way."—Nissa Revane

card.name: Elvish Visionary
card.ability: When Elvish Visionary enters the battlefield, draw a card.
card.flavor: "From a tiny sprout, the greatest trees grow and flourish. May the seeds of your mind be equally fruitful."

card.name: Embermaw Hellion
card.ability: Trample (This creature can deal excess combat damage to defending player or planeswalker while attacking.)\nIf another red source you control would deal damage to a permanent or player, it deals that much damage plus 1 to that permanent or player instead.

card.name: Enlightened Ascetic
card.ability: When Enlightened Ascetic enters the battlefield, you may destroy target enchantment.
card.flavor: "I do not reject the gods. I reject their authority, their pettiness, and their arrogance."

card.name: Enshrouding Mist
card.ability: Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn. Prevent all damage that would be dealt to it this turn. If it's renowned, untap it.
card.flavor: True faith is letting the blade fall without parry. True cunning is using that moment to strike a deadly blow.

card.name: Enthralling Victor
card.ability: When Enthralling Victor enters the battlefield, gain control of target creature an opponent controls with power 2 or less until end of turn. Untap that creature. It gains haste until end of turn. (It can attack and {T} this turn.)
card.flavor: If you stare at the sun for too long, you'll lose your ability to see clearly.

card.name: Erebos's Titan
card.ability: As long as your opponents control no creatures, Erebos's Titan has indestructible. (Damage and effects that say "destroy" don't destroy it.)\nWhenever a creature card leaves an opponent's graveyard, you may discard a card. If you do, return Erebos's Titan from your graveyard to your hand.

card.name: Evolutionary Leap
card.ability: {G}, Sacrifice a creature: Reveal cards from the top of your library until you reveal a creature card. Put that card into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library in a random order.
card.flavor: The essence of nature is change.

card.name: Evolving Wilds
card.ability: {T}, Sacrifice Evolving Wilds: Search your library for a basic land card and put it onto the battlefield tapped. Then shuffle your library.
card.flavor: Without the interfering hands of civilization, nature will always shape itself to its own needs.

card.name: Exquisite Firecraft
card.ability: Exquisite Firecraft deals 4 damage to target creature or player.\nSpell mastery — If there are two or more instant and/or sorcery cards in your graveyard, Exquisite Firecraft can't be countered by spells or abilities.
card.flavor: Chandra's gift set her apart and others aflame.

card.name: Eyeblight Assassin
card.ability: When Eyeblight Assassin enters the battlefield, target creature an opponent controls gets -1/-1 until end of turn.
card.flavor: "Boggart blood disgusts me almost as much as the foul creatures themselves."

card.name: Eyeblight Massacre
card.ability: Non-Elf creatures get -2/-2 until end of turn.
card.flavor: "I've already seen so much evil, so much darkness. Why do you insist on adding more?"—Nissa Revane, to Dwynen

card.name: Faerie Miscreant
card.ability: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)\nWhen Faerie Miscreant enters the battlefield, if you control another creature named Faerie Miscreant, draw a card.
card.flavor: One faerie distracts the judge while a second steals the law.

card.name: Fetid Imp
card.ability: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)\n{B}: Fetid Imp gains deathtouch until end of turn. (Any amount of damage it deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)

card.name: Fiery Conclusion
card.ability: As an additional cost to cast Fiery Conclusion, sacrifice a creature.\nFiery Conclusion deals 5 damage to target creature.
card.flavor: The Boros legionnaire saw a noble sacrifice, the Rakdos thug a blazing suicide, and the Izzet alchemist an experiment gone awry.
card.ruling: \n4/15/2013 : You must sacrifice exactly one creature to cast this spell; you cannot cast it without sacrificing a creature, and you cannot sacrifice additional creatures. \n4/15/2013 : Players can only respond once this spell has been cast and all its costs have been paid. No one can try to destroy the creature you sacrificed to prevent you from casting this spell.

card.name: Fiery Impulse
card.ability: Fiery Impulse deals 2 damage to target creature.\nSpell mastery — If there are two or more instant and/or sorcery cards in your graveyard, Fiery Impulse deals 3 damage to that creature instead.
card.flavor: "Well, this got out of hand."

card.name: Firefiend Elemental
card.ability: Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)\nRenown 1 (When this creature deals combat damage to a player, if it isn't renowned, put a +1/+1 counter on it and it becomes renowned.)

card.name: Flameshadow Conjuring
card.ability: Whenever a nontoken creature enters the battlefield under your control, you may pay {R}. If you do, put a token onto the battlefield that's a copy of that creature. That token gains haste. Exile it at the beginning of the next end step.

card.name: Fleshbag Marauder
card.ability: When Fleshbag Marauder enters the battlefield, each player sacrifices a creature.
card.flavor: Grixis is a world where the only things found in abundance are death and decay. Corpses, whole or in part, are the standard currency among necromancers and demons.
card.ruling: \n10/1/2008 : When the ability resolves, you may sacrifice Fleshbag Marauder itself. If you control no other creatures, you'll have to sacrifice Fleshbag Marauder.

card.name: Foundry of the Consuls
card.ability: {T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.\n{5}, {T}, Sacrifice Foundry of the Consuls: Put two 1/1 colorless Thopter artifact creature tokens with flying onto the battlefield.
card.flavor: All around the foundry, automatons unhitched themselves from their mounts and pivoted to face Chandra.

card.name: Gaea's Revenge
card.ability: Gaea's Revenge can't be countered.\nHaste\nGaea's Revenge can't be the target of nongreen spells or abilities from nongreen sources.
card.ruling:
8/15/2010 : Gaea's Revenge's first ability works only while it's a spell on the stack. Gaea's Revenge's last ability works only while it's on the battlefield. 
8/15/2010 : A Gaea's Revenge spell can be targeted by spells and abilities that try to counter it (such as Cancel). Those spells and abilities will resolve, but the part of their effect that would counter Gaea's Revenge won't do anything. Any other effects those spells and abilities have will work as normal. 
8/15/2010 : Gaea's Revenge's last ability applies to all nongreen spells and abilities from nongreen sources, including ones you control. For example, you can't target it with the equip ability of an Equipment you control (unless the Equipment is somehow green).

card.name: Gather the Pack
card.ability: Reveal the top five cards of your library. You may put a creature card from among them into your hand. Put the rest into your graveyard.\nSpell mastery — If there are two or more instant and/or sorcery cards in your graveyard, put up to two creature cards from among the revealed cards into your hand instead of one.

card.name: Ghirapur Æther Grid
card.ability: Tap two untapped artifacts you control: Ghirapur Æther Grid deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
card.flavor: The city of Ghirapur is a living thing, and living things defend themselves.

card.name: Ghirapur Gearcrafter
card.ability: When Ghirapur Gearcrafter enters the battlefield, put a 1/1 colorless Thopter artifact creature token with flying onto the battlefield. (A creature with flying can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
card.flavor: The metal must be pure. The hand must be steady. The product must be perfect.

card.name: Gideon, Battle-Forged
card.ability: At end of combat, if Kytheon, Hero of Akros and at least two other creatures attacked this combat, exile Kytheon, then return him to the battlefield transformed under his owner's control.\n{2}{W}: Kytheon gains indestructible until end of turn.

card.name: Gideon's Phalanx
card.ability: Put four 2/2 white Knight creature tokens with vigilance onto the battlefield.\nSpell mastery — If there are two or more instant and/or sorcery cards in your graveyard, creatures you control gain indestructible until end of turn.

card.name: Gilt-Leaf Winnower
card.ability: Menace (This creature can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.)\nWhen Gilt-Leaf Winnower enters the battlefield, you may destroy target non-Elf creature whose power and toughness aren't equal.

card.name: Gnarlroot Trapper
card.ability: {T}, Pay 1 life: Add {G} to your mana pool. Spend this mana only to cast an Elf creature spell.\n{T}: Target attacking Elf you control gains deathtouch until end of turn. (Any amount of damage it deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)

card.name: Goblin Glory Chaser
card.ability: Renown 1 (When this creature deals combat damage to a player, if it isn't renowned, put a +1/+1 counter on it and it becomes renowned.)\nAs long as Goblin Glory Chaser is renowned, it has menace. (It can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.)

card.name: Goblin Piledriver
card.ability: Protection from blue (This creature can't be blocked, targeted, dealt damage, or enchanted by anything blue.)\nWhenever Goblin Piledriver attacks, it gets +2/+0 until end of turn for each other attacking Goblin.
card.ruling: \n10/4/2004 : The number of Goblins is counted when this ability resolves.

card.name: Gold-Forged Sentinel
card.ability: Flying
card.flavor: Blessed by the gods. Coveted by mortals. Beholden to neither.

card.name: Grasp of the Hieromancer
card.ability: Enchant creature\nEnchanted creature gets +1/+1 and has "Whenever this creature attacks, tap target creature defending player controls."
card.flavor: "There is power in abandon, but far more in control."—Warden Hixus, to Kytheon

card.name: Graveblade Marauder
card.ability: Deathtouch (Any amount of damage this deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)\nWhenever Graveblade Marauder deals combat damage to a player, that player loses life equal to the number of creature cards in your graveyard.

card.name: Guardian Automaton
card.ability: When Guardian Automaton dies, you gain 3 life.
card.flavor: The wealthy in the city of Ghirapur outfit their lives with grand machines, entrusting even their children to filigree and gears.

card.name: Guardians of Meletis
card.ability: Defender (This creature can't attack.)
card.flavor: The histories speak of two feuding rulers whose deaths were celebrated and whose monuments symbolized the end of their wars. In truth they were peaceful lovers, their story lost to the ages.

card.name: Hallowed Moonlight
card.ability: Until end of turn, if a creature would enter the battlefield and it wasn't cast, exile it instead.\nDraw a card.
card.flavor: Creatures of darkness instinctively hide from the light.

card.name: Hangarback Walker
card.ability: Hangarback Walker enters the battlefield with X +1/+1 counters on it.\nWhen Hangarback Walker dies, put a 1/1 colorless Thopter artifact creature token with flying onto the battlefield for each +1/+1 counter on Hangarback Walker.\n{1}, {T}: Put a +1/+1 counter on Hangarback Walker.

card.name: Harbinger of the Tides
card.ability: You may cast Harbinger of the Tides as though it had flash if you pay {2} more to cast it. (You may cast it any time you could cast an instant.)\nWhen Harbinger of the Tides enters the battlefield, you may return target tapped creature an opponent controls to its owner's hand.

card.name: Healing Hands
card.ability: Target player gains 4 life.\nDraw a card.
card.flavor: The ethereal touch brings relief. The physical touch brings peace.

card.name: Heavy Infantry
card.ability: When Heavy Infantry enters the battlefield, tap target creature an opponent controls.
card.flavor: Doors, walls, skulls . . . it matters not. All barriers will be broken.

card.name: Helm of the Gods
card.ability: Equipped creature gets +1/+1 for each enchantment you control.\nEquip {1} ({1}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)
card.flavor: Its blessings are as numerous as the stars of Nyx.

card.name: Herald of the Pantheon
card.ability: Enchantment spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.\nWhenever you cast an enchantment spell, you gain 1 life.
card.flavor: The distinction of bearing the gods' banner is nothing compared to the glory of being closer to Nyx.

card.name: Hitchclaw Recluse
card.ability: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
card.flavor: Not all spiders need webs to catch their prey.

card.name: Hixus, Prison Warden
card.ability: Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)\nWhenever a creature deals combat damage to you, if Hixus, Prison Warden entered the battlefield this turn, exile that creature until Hixus leaves the battlefield. (That creature returns under its owner's control.)

card.name: Honored Hierarch
card.ability: Renown 1 (When this creature deals combat damage to a player, if it isn't renowned, put a +1/+1 counter on it and it becomes renowned.)\nAs long as Honored Hierarch is renowned, it has vigilance and "{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool."

card.name: Hydrolash
card.ability: Attacking creatures get -2/-0 until end of turn.\nDraw a card.
card.flavor: "I don't need your mage-rings or your mana equations. I call, and the sea answers."—Keyta, rebel hydromancer

card.name: Infectious Bloodlust
card.ability: Enchant creature\nEnchanted creature gets +2/+1, has haste, and attacks each turn if able.\nWhen enchanted creature dies, you may search your library for a card named Infectious Bloodlust, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.

card.name: Infernal Scarring
card.ability: Enchant creature\nEnchanted creature gets +2/+0 and has "When this creature dies, draw a card."
card.flavor: One who is marked by a demon in life is sure to be remembered as one in death.

card.name: Infinite Obliteration
card.ability: Name a creature card. Search target opponent's graveyard, hand, and library for any number of cards with that name and exile them. Then that player shuffles his or her library.

card.name: Iroas's Champion
card.ability: Double strike (This creature deals both first-strike and regular combat damage.)
card.flavor: Accustomed to battling before an audience in the arena, Iroas's champions know how to put on a good show.

card.name: Jace, Telepath Unbound
card.ability: {T}: Draw a card, then discard a card. If there are five or more cards in your graveyard, exile Jace, Vryn's Prodigy, then return him to the battlefield transformed under his owner's control.

card.name: Jace, Vryn's Prodigy
card.ability: {T}: Draw a card, then discard a card. If there are five or more cards in your graveyard, exile Jace, Vryn's Prodigy, then return him to the battlefield transformed under his owner's control.

card.name: Jace's Sanctum
card.ability: Instant and sorcery spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.\nWhenever you cast an instant or sorcery spell, scry 1. (Look at the top card of your library. You may put that card on the bottom of your library.)

card.name: Jayemdae Tome
card.ability: {4}, {T}: Draw a card.
card.flavor: A true scribe devotes an entire lifetime to the creation of a single volume, a masterpiece as unique as its maker.

card.name: Jhessian Thief
card.ability: Prowess (Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, this creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)\nWhenever Jhessian Thief deals combat damage to a player, draw a card.
card.flavor: "Where's the fun in an escape if it's not at least a little daring?"

card.name: Joraga Invocation
card.ability: Each creature you control gets +3/+3 until end of turn and must be blocked this turn if able.
card.flavor: "A single tree does not a forest make. We are stronger when we stand together."—Numa, Joraga chieftain

card.name: Knight of the Pilgrim's Road
card.ability: Renown 1 (When this creature deals combat damage to a player, if it isn't renowned, put a +1/+1 counter on it and it becomes renowned.)
card.flavor: "To be a knight, Gideon, is to be the shield for the meek against the cruel."

card.name: Knight of the White Orchid
card.ability: First strike\nWhen Knight of the White Orchid enters the battlefield, if an opponent controls more lands than you, you may search your library for a Plains card, put it onto the battlefield, then shuffle your library.
card.ruling: \n10/1/2008 : Knight of the White Orchid's triggered ability has an "intervening 'if' clause." That means (1) the ability won't trigger at all unless any one of your opponents controls more lands than you, and (2) the ability will do nothing if you control at least as many lands as each of your opponents by the time it resolves.

card.name: Knightly Valor
card.ability: Enchant creature\nWhen Knightly Valor enters the battlefield, put a 2/2 white Knight creature token with vigilance onto the battlefield. (Attacking doesn't cause it to tap.)\nEnchanted creature gets +2/+2 and has vigilance.
card.ruling: \n10/1/2012 : You must target a creature to cast Knightly Valor. If that creature is an illegal target when Knightly Valor tries to resolve, it will be countered and won't enter the battlefield. You won't get the Knight token.

card.name: Kothophed, Soul Hoarder
card.ability: Flying\nWhenever a permanent owned by another player is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, you draw a card and you lose 1 life.
card.flavor: "I will be your most demanding master, Liliana. But I have great things in mind for you."

card.name: Kytheon, Hero of Akros
card.ability: At end of combat, if Kytheon, Hero of Akros and at least two other creatures attacked this combat, exile Kytheon, then return him to the battlefield transformed under his owner's control.\n{2}{W}: Kytheon gains indestructible until end of turn.

card.name: Kytheon's Irregulars
card.ability: Renown 1 (When this creature deals combat damage to a player, if it isn't renowned, put a +1/+1 counter on it and it becomes renowned.)\n{W}{W}: Tap target creature.
card.flavor: Kytheon and his irregulars worked outside the law to bring justice to the streets of Akros.

card.name: Kytheon's Tactics
card.ability: Creatures you control get +2/+1 until end of turn.\nSpell mastery — If there are two or more instant and/or sorcery cards in your graveyard, those creatures also gain vigilance until end of turn. (Attacking doesn't cause them to tap.)
card.flavor: "Seal the gate. This is our fight now."

card.name: Languish
card.ability: All creatures get -4/-4 until end of turn.
card.flavor: Life is such a fragile thing.

card.name: Leaf Gilder
card.ability: {T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.
card.flavor: Eidren, perfect of Lys Alana, ordered hundreds of trees uprooted and rearranged into a pattern he deemed beautiful. Thus the Gilt-Leaf Wood was born.

card.name: Lightning Javelin
card.ability: Lightning Javelin deals 3 damage to target creature or player. Scry 1. (Look at the top card of your library. You may put that card on the bottom of your library.)
card.flavor: The harpies descended without mercy upon Akros, only to find their attack put them within range of the javelineers.

card.name: Liliana, Defiant Necromancer
card.ability: Lifelink\nWhenever another nontoken creature you control dies, exile Liliana, Heretical Healer, then return her to the battlefield transformed under her owner's control. If you do, put a 2/2 black Zombie creature token onto the battlefield.

card.name: Liliana, Heretical Healer
card.ability: Lifelink\nWhenever another nontoken creature you control dies, exile Liliana, Heretical Healer, then return her to the battlefield transformed under her owner's control. If you do, put a 2/2 black Zombie creature token onto the battlefield.

card.name: Llanowar Empath
card.ability: When Llanowar Empath enters the battlefield, scry 2, then reveal the top card of your library. If it's a creature card, put it into your hand. (To scry 2, look at the top two cards of your library, then put any number of them on the bottom of your library and the rest on top in any order.)

card.name: Llanowar Wastes
card.ability: {T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.\n{T}: Add {B} or {G} to your mana pool. Llanowar Wastes deals 1 damage to you.

card.name: Macabre Waltz
card.ability: Return up to two target creature cards from your graveyard to your hand, then discard a card.
card.flavor: "All dead move to the hollow rhythm of necromancy."—Savra

card.name: Mage-Ring Bully
card.ability: Prowess (Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, this creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)\nMage-Ring Bully attacks each turn if able.
card.flavor: "Don't be rude, Beleren. We just want to enjoy the view with you."

card.name: Mage-Ring Network
card.ability: {T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.\n{1}, {T}: Put a storage counter on Mage-Ring Network.\n{T}, Remove X storage counters from Mage-Ring Network: Add {X} to your mana pool.

card.name: Mage-Ring Responder
card.ability: Mage-Ring Responder doesn't untap during your untap step.\n{7}: Untap Mage-Ring Responder.\nWhenever Mage-Ring Responder attacks, it deals 7 damage to target creature defending player controls.

card.name: Magmatic Insight
card.ability: As an additional cost to cast Magmatic Insight, discard a land card.\nDraw two cards.
card.flavor: Chief among the tenets of Purphoros is that one must destroy in order to create.

card.name: Malakir Cullblade
card.ability: Whenever a creature an opponent controls dies, put a +1/+1 counter on Malakir Cullblade.
card.flavor: Each cut stains his blade with fresh blood that he samples to increase his strength.

card.name: Managorger Hydra
card.ability: Trample (This creature can deal excess combat damage to defending player or planeswalker while attacking.)\nWhenever a player casts a spell, put a +1/+1 counter on Managorger Hydra.

card.name: Mantle of Webs
card.ability: Enchant creature\nEnchanted creature gets +1/+3 and has reach. (It can block creatures with flying.)
card.flavor: "Why does everything the Golgari touch end up sticky?"—Arrester Lavinia, Tenth Precinct

card.name: Maritime Guard
card.flavor: To stand as a guardian of the sea, one must possess the resolve of a mounting wave.

card.name: Meteorite
card.ability: When Meteorite enters the battlefield, it deals 2 damage to target creature or player.\n{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.
card.flavor: "And if I'm lying," he began . . .

card.name: Might of the Masses
card.ability: Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn for each creature you control.
card.flavor: The Joraga elves never need ask a troll to leave their territory. They merely grant it their combined strength, and it can't resist embarking on a merry rampage.
card.ruling: \n6/15/2010 : The bonus is determined as Might of the Masses resolves. It won't change if the number of creatures you control changes later in the turn. \n6/15/2010 : If you target a creature you control with Might of the Masses, remember to count that one when determining the amount of the bonus.

card.name: Mighty Leap
card.ability: Target creature gets +2/+2 and gains flying until end of turn. (It can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
card.flavor: "The southern fortress taken by invaders? Heh, sure . . . when elephants fly."—Brezard Skeinbow, captain of the guard
card.ruling: \n8/15/2010 : You may target any creature with Mighty Leap. It's okay if that creature already has flying. \n8/15/2010 : For flying to work as an evasion ability, Mighty Leap must be cast before the declare blockers step begins. Once a creature has become blocked, giving it flying won't change that.

card.name: Mizzium Meddler
card.ability: Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)\nWhen Mizzium Meddler enters the battlefield, you may change a target of target spell or ability to Mizzium Meddler.
card.flavor: Energy surges in Izzet labs are opportunities for experimentation.

card.name: Molten Vortex
card.ability: {R}, Discard a land card: Molten Vortex deals 2 damage to target creature or player.
card.flavor: If you can't take the heat . . . well, that's going to be a problem.

card.name: Murder Investigation
card.ability: Enchant creature you control\nWhen enchanted creature dies, put X 1/1 white Soldier creature tokens onto the battlefield, where X is its power.
card.flavor: "Every death has a web of consequences. Our job is to find the spider."
card.ruling: \n1/24/2013 : To determine how many Soldier tokens are created, use the power of the enchanted creature as it last existed on the battlefield. \n1/24/2013 : If another player gains control of either Murder Investigation or the enchanted creature (but not both), Murder Investigation will be enchanting an illegal permanent. The Aura will be put into its owner's graveyard as a state-based action.

card.name: Nantuko Husk
card.ability: Sacrifice a creature: Nantuko Husk gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
card.flavor: "The soul sheds light, and death is its shadow. When the light dims, life and death embrace."—Nantuko teaching

card.name: Necromantic Summons
card.ability: Put target creature card from a graveyard onto the battlefield under your control.\nSpell mastery — If there are two or more instant and/or sorcery cards in your graveyard, that creature enters the battlefield with two additional +1/+1 counters on it.

card.name: Negate
card.ability: Counter target noncreature spell.
card.flavor: Masters of the arcane savor a delicious irony. Their study of deep and complex arcana leads to such a simple end: the ability to say merely yes or no.
card.ruling: \n10/1/2009 : A "creature spell" is any spell with the type Creature, even if it has other types such as Artifact or Enchantment. Older cards of type Summon are also Creature spells.

card.name: Nightsnare
card.ability: Target opponent reveals his or her hand. You may choose a nonland card from it. If you do, that player discards that card. If you don't, that player discards two cards.
card.flavor: Ravnica would be safer if mere coin was all the Dimir could steal.

card.name: Nissa, Sage Animist
card.ability: When Nissa, Vastwood Seer enters the battlefield, you may search your library for a basic Forest card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.\nWhenever a land enters the battlefield under your control, if you control seven or more lands, exile Nissa, then return her to the battlefield transformed under her owner's control.

card.name: Nissa, Vastwood Seer
card.ability: When Nissa, Vastwood Seer enters the battlefield, you may search your library for a basic Forest card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.\nWhenever a land enters the battlefield under your control, if you control seven or more lands, exile Nissa, then return her to the battlefield transformed under her owner's control.

card.name: Nissa's Pilgrimage
card.ability: Search your library for up to two basic Forest cards, reveal those cards, and put one onto the battlefield tapped and the rest into your hand. Then shuffle your library.\nSpell mastery — If there are two or more instant and/or sorcery cards in your graveyard, search your library for up to three basic Forest cards instead of two.

card.name: Nissa's Revelation
card.ability: Scry 5, then reveal the top card of your library. If it's a creature card, you draw cards equal to its power and you gain life equal to its toughness.
card.flavor: The evil inside the mountain pulsed at Nissa in a shock wave of madness.

card.name: Nivix Barrier
card.ability: Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)\nDefender (This creature can't attack.)\nWhen Nivix Barrier enters the battlefield, target attacking creature gets -4/-0 until end of turn.

card.name: Orbs of Warding
card.ability: You have hexproof. (You can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)\nIf a creature would deal damage to you, prevent 1 of that damage.
card.flavor: One orb to guard the body, one to protect the mind, and one to shield the soul.

card.name: Orchard Spirit
card.ability: Orchard Spirit can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.
card.flavor: "Pick not the rotten fruit, but neither touch the best. Leave those as an offering for our unseen guests."—Radwick, farmer of Gatstaf

card.name: Outland Colossus
card.ability: Renown 6 (When this creature deals combat damage to a player, if it isn't renowned, put six +1/+1 counters on it and it becomes renowned.)\nOutland Colossus can't be blocked by more than one creature.

card.name: Patron of the Valiant
card.ability: Flying\nWhen Patron of the Valiant enters the battlefield, put a +1/+1 counter on each creature you control with a +1/+1 counter on it.
card.flavor: "Bant's most gallant knights wear my sigil, and for that I am humbled."

card.name: Pharika's Disciple
card.ability: Deathtouch (Any amount of damage this deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)\nRenown 1 (When this creature deals combat damage to a player, if it isn't renowned, put a +1/+1 counter on it and it becomes renowned.)

card.name: Pia and Kiran Nalaar
card.ability: When Pia and Kiran Nalaar enters the battlefield, put two 1/1 colorless Thopter artifact creature tokens with flying onto the battlefield.\n{2}{R}, Sacrifice an artifact: Pia and Kiran Nalaar deals 2 damage to target creature or player.

card.name: Possessed Skaab
card.ability: When Possessed Skaab enters the battlefield, return target instant, sorcery, or creature card from your graveyard to your hand.\nIf Possessed Skaab would die, exile it instead.
card.flavor: A stitcher's attempt at a skaab with a soul.

card.name: Prickleboar
card.ability: As long as it's your turn, Prickleboar gets +2/+0 and has first strike. (It deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
card.flavor: "Canyons in the Phoberos badlands are essentially gates to the Underworld."—Mirinthes, Akroan captain

card.name: Priest of the Blood Rite
card.ability: When Priest of the Blood Rite enters the battlefield, put a 5/5 black Demon creature token with flying onto the battlefield.\nAt the beginning of your upkeep, you lose 2 life.
card.flavor: Some will sacrifice everything for but a taste of power.

card.name: Prism Ring
card.ability: As Prism Ring enters the battlefield, choose a color.\nWhenever you cast a spell of the chosen color, you gain 1 life.
card.flavor: Wear it on your dominant hand and it will follow your lead.

card.name: Psychic Rebuttal
card.ability: Counter target instant or sorcery spell that targets you.\nSpell mastery — If there are two or more instant and/or sorcery cards in your graveyard, you may copy the spell countered this way. You may choose new targets for the copy.
card.flavor: "I know what you're thinking," Jace whispered in the mage's mind. "It's not going to work."

card.name: Pyromancer's Goggles
card.ability: {T}: Add {R} to your mana pool. When that mana is spent to cast a red instant or sorcery spell, copy that spell and you may choose new targets for the copy.
card.flavor: "I hope to meet Jaya Ballard someday. I think we'd get along."—Chandra Nalaar

card.name: Rabid Bloodsucker
card.ability: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)\nWhen Rabid Bloodsucker enters the battlefield, each player loses 2 life.
card.flavor: She haunts the streets, wings spread wide, with carrion on her breath and blood in her eyes.

card.name: Ramroller
card.ability: Ramroller attacks each turn if able.\nRamroller gets +2/+0 as long as you control another artifact.
card.flavor: As unstoppable as it is unsteerable.

card.name: Ravaging Blaze
card.ability: Ravaging Blaze deals X damage to target creature. \nSpell mastery — If there are two or more instant and/or sorcery cards in your graveyard, Ravaging Blaze also deals X damage to that creature's controller.
card.flavor: In time, not even the fire monks could keep up with Chandra.

card.name: Read the Bones
card.ability: Scry 2, then draw two cards. You lose 2 life. (To scry 2, look at the top two cards of your library, then put any number of them on the bottom of your library and the rest on top in any order.)
card.flavor: The dead know lessons the living haven't learned.
card.ruling:
9/15/2013 : The loss of life is part of the spell’s effect. It’s not an additional cost. If Read the Bones is countered, you won’t lose life. 
9/15/2013 : When you scry, you may put all the cards you look at back on top of your library, you may put all of those cards on the bottom of your library, or you may put some of those cards on top and the rest of them on the bottom. 
9/15/2013 : You choose how to order cards returned to your library after scrying no matter where you put them. 
9/15/2013 : You perform the actions stated on a card in sequence. For some spells and abilities, that means you’ll scry last. For others, that means you’ll scry and then perform other actions. 
9/15/2013 : Scry appears on some spells and abilities with one or more targets. If all of the spell or ability’s targets are illegal when it tries to resolve, it will be countered and none of its effects will happen. You won’t scry.

card.name: Reave Soul
card.ability: Destroy target creature with power 3 or less.
card.flavor: "I was not convinced you had a soul until I saw it for myself."—Liliana Vess

card.name: Reclaim
card.ability: Put target card from your graveyard on top of your library.
card.flavor: The wise pay as much attention to what they throw away as to what they keep.

card.name: Reclusive Artificer
card.ability: Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)\nWhen Reclusive Artificer enters the battlefield, you may have it deal damage to target creature equal to the number of artifacts you control.

card.name: Relic Seeker
card.ability: Renown 1 (When this creature deals combat damage to a player, if it isn't renowned, put a +1/+1 counter on it and it becomes renowned.)\nWhen Relic Seeker becomes renowned, you may search your library for an Equipment card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.

card.name: Returned Centaur
card.ability: When Returned Centaur enters the battlefield, target player puts the top four cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.
card.flavor: Driven away by his living kin, he wanders mourning through the wilderness, seeking the dead city of Asphodel.

card.name: Revenant
card.ability: Flying\nRevenant's power and toughness are each equal to the number of creature cards in your graveyard.
card.flavor: Born from the slaughter of an entire army, it bears the wrath of a hundred souls.

card.name: Rhox Maulers
card.ability: Trample (This creature can deal excess combat damage to defending player or planeswalker while attacking.)\nRenown 2 (When this creature deals combat damage to a player, if it isn't renowned, put two +1/+1 counters on it and it becomes renowned.)

card.name: Ringwarden Owl
card.ability: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)\nProwess (Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, this creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
card.flavor: The owls learn of mana from the mages who know it best.

card.name: Rogue's Passage
card.ability: {T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.\n{4}, {T}: Target creature can't be blocked this turn.
card.flavor: Rumors quickly spread among thieves about a labyrinth without walls and a prize beyond all measures of worth.
card.ruling: \n10/1/2012 : Activating the second ability of Rogue's Passage after a creature has become blocked won't cause it to become unblocked.

card.name: Runed Servitor
card.ability: When Runed Servitor dies, each player draws a card.
card.flavor: Scholars had puzzled for centuries over the ruins at Tal Terig. Its secrets had always lived within one rune-carved head.

card.name: Scab-Clan Berserker
card.ability: Haste\nRenown 1 (When this creature deals combat damage to a player, if it isn't renowned, put a +1/+1 counter on it and it becomes renowned.)\nWhenever an opponent casts a noncreature spell, if Scab-Clan Berserker is renowned, Scab-Clan Berserker deals 2 damage to that player.

card.name: Scrapskin Drake
card.ability: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)\nScrapskin Drake can block only creatures with flying.
card.flavor: "The cathars killed my skaabs down below. Let's see how high their swords can reach."—Ludevic, necro-alchemist

card.name: Screeching Skaab
card.ability: When Screeching Skaab enters the battlefield, put the top two cards of your library into your graveyard.
card.flavor: Its screeching is the sound of you losing your mind.

card.name: Seismic Elemental
card.ability: When Seismic Elemental enters the battlefield, creatures without flying can't block this turn.
card.flavor: "Trying to stop it would be foolish. If you feel it coming—run!"—Sergeant Ryda

card.name: Send to Sleep
card.ability: Tap up to two target creatures.\nSpell mastery — If there are two or more instant and/or sorcery cards in your graveyard, those creatures don't untap during their controllers' next untap steps.

card.name: Sentinel of the Eternal Watch
card.ability: Vigilance (Attacking doesn't cause this creature to tap.)\nAt the beginning of combat on each opponent's turn, tap target creature that player controls.
card.flavor: The portcullis is superfluous.

card.name: Separatist Voidmage
card.ability: When Separatist Voidmage enters the battlefield, you may return target creature to its owner's hand.
card.flavor: "As long as each side thinks it can win, the balance holds, and the mage-rings stand."—Alhammarret

card.name: Shadows of the Past
card.ability: Whenever a creature dies, scry 1. (Look at the top card of your library. You may put that card on the bottom of your library.)\n{4}{B}: Each opponent loses 2 life and you gain 2 life. Activate this ability only if there are four or more creature cards in your graveyard.

card.name: Shaman of the Pack
card.ability: When Shaman of the Pack enters the battlefield, target opponent loses life equal to the number of Elves you control.
card.flavor: To the elves, her spear is a compass; to the boggarts, a harbinger of doom.

card.name: Shambling Ghoul
card.ability: Shambling Ghoul enters the battlefield tapped.
card.flavor: Once he gets up and going, he will forever shamble on.

card.name: Shivan Reef
card.ability: {T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.\n{T}: Add {U} or {R} to your mana pool. Shivan Reef deals 1 damage to you.

card.name: Sigil of the Empty Throne
card.ability: Whenever you cast an enchantment spell, put a 4/4 white Angel creature token with flying onto the battlefield.
card.flavor: When Asha left Bant, she ensured that the world would have protection and order in her absence.
card.ruling:
2/1/2009 : The triggered ability will resolve before the enchantment spell that caused it to trigger. 
2/1/2009 : When you cast an Aura spell, you have to choose a target for it before this ability puts an Angel token onto the battlefield. In other words, you can't play an Aura spell intending to enchant the Angel that will be created as a result. 
2/1/2009 : Casting Sigil of the Empty Throne won't trigger its own ability. It has to be on the battlefield for its ability to work.

card.name: Sigil of Valor
card.ability: Whenever equipped creature attacks alone, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn for each other creature you control.\nEquip {1} ({1}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)
card.flavor: With each honor he earns, Gideon paves the path to his redemption.

card.name: Sigiled Starfish
card.ability: {T}: Scry 1. (Look at the top card of your library. You may put that card on the bottom of your library.)
card.flavor: Kruphix hid the most dire prophecies about humankind where humans would never find them and tritons wouldn't care to read them.

card.name: Skaab Goliath
card.ability: As an additional cost to cast Skaab Goliath, exile two creature cards from your graveyard.\nTrample (This creature can deal excess combat damage to defending player or planeswalker while attacking.)
card.flavor: Three heads are better than one.

card.name: Skyraker Giant
card.ability: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
card.flavor: She will not be content until hers is the highest head in the sky.

card.name: Skysnare Spider
card.ability: Vigilance (Attacking doesn't cause this creature to tap.)\nReach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
card.flavor: The only thing more ill-tempered than a griffin in a web is the spider that must subdue it.

card.name: Smash to Smithereens
card.ability: Destroy target artifact. Smash to Smithereens deals 3 damage to that artifact's controller.
card.flavor: The giant Tarvik dreamed that trinkets and machines caused all the world's woe. When he awoke from his troubled sleep, he took the name Tarvik Relicsmasher.

card.name: Somberwald Alpha
card.ability: Whenever a creature you control becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn.\n{1}{G}: Target creature you control gains trample until end of turn. (It can deal excess combat damage to defending player or planeswalker while attacking.)

card.name: Soulblade Djinn
card.ability: Flying\nWhenever you cast a noncreature spell, creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.
card.flavor: He grants endless wishes, as long as you always wish for a blade.

card.name: Sphinx's Tutelage
card.ability: Whenever you draw a card, target opponent puts the top two cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard. If they're both nonland cards that share a color, repeat this process.\n{5}{U}: Draw a card, then discard a card.
card.flavor: "You've never considered the implications of dealing with another telepath, Jace."

card.name: Stalwart Aven
card.ability: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)\nRenown 1 (When this creature deals combat damage to a player, if it isn't renowned, put a +1/+1 counter on it and it becomes renowned.)

card.name: Starfield of Nyx
card.ability: At the beginning of your upkeep, you may return target enchantment card from your graveyard to the battlefield.\nAs long as you control five or more enchantments, each other non-Aura enchantment you control is a creature in addition to its other types and has base power and base toughness each equal to its converted mana cost.

card.name: Stratus Walk
card.ability:
Enchant creature
When Stratus Walk enters the battlefield, draw a card.
Enchanted creature has flying. (It can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Enchanted creature can block only creatures with flying.

card.name: Subterranean Scout
card.ability: When Subterranean Scout enters the battlefield, target creature with power 2 or less can't be blocked this turn.
card.flavor: When things get ugly above ground, goblins resort to alternate routes of passage.

card.name: Suppression Bonds
card.ability: Enchant nonland permanent\nEnchanted permanent can't attack or block, and its activated abilities can't be activated.
card.flavor: "A master of hieromancy can see the advantage in any scenario."—Warden Hixus, to Kytheon

card.name: Swift Reckoning
card.ability: Spell mastery — If there are two or more instant and/or sorcery cards in your graveyard, you may cast Swift Reckoning as though it had flash. (You may cast it any time you could cast an instant.)\nDestroy target tapped creature.

card.name: Sword of the Animist
card.ability: Equipped creature gets +1/+1.\nWhenever equipped creature attacks, you may search your library for a basic land card, put it onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle your library.\nEquip {2}
card.flavor: The blade glows only for Zendikar's chosen.

card.name: Sylvan Messenger
card.ability: Trample (This creature can deal excess combat damage to defending player or planeswalker while attacking.)\nWhen Sylvan Messenger enters the battlefield, reveal the top four cards of your library. Put all Elf cards revealed this way into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.

card.name: Tainted Remedy
card.ability: If an opponent would gain life, that player loses that much life instead.
card.flavor: "Drink this, brother. It will bring you rest."—Liliana Vess

card.name: Talent of the Telepath
card.ability: Target opponent reveals the top seven cards of his or her library. You may cast an instant or sorcery card from among them without paying its mana cost. Then that player puts the rest into his or her graveyard.\nSpell mastery — If there are two or more instant and/or sorcery cards in your graveyard, you may cast up to two revealed instant and/or sorcery cards instead of one.

card.name: The Great Aurora
card.ability: Each player shuffles all cards from his or her hand and all permanents he or she owns into his or her library, then draws that many cards. Each player may put any number of land cards from his or her hand onto the battlefield. Exile The Great Aurora.

card.name: Thopter Engineer
card.ability: When Thopter Engineer enters the battlefield, put a 1/1 colorless Thopter artifact creature token with flying onto the battlefield.\nArtifact creatures you control have haste. (They can attack and {T} as soon as they come under your control.)

card.name: Thopter Spy Network
card.ability: At the beginning of your upkeep, if you control an artifact, put a 1/1 colorless Thopter artifact creature token with flying onto the battlefield.\nWhenever one or more artifact creatures you control deal combat damage to a player, draw a card.

card.name: Thornbow Archer
card.ability: Whenever Thornbow Archer attacks, each opponent who doesn't control an Elf loses 1 life.
card.flavor: "I will not rest until the stench of eyeblights is eradicated from these woods."

card.name: Throwing Knife
card.ability: Equipped creature gets +2/+0.\nWhenever equipped creature attacks, you may sacrifice Throwing Knife. If you do, Throwing Knife deals 2 damage to target creature or player.\nEquip {2} ({2}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)

card.name: Thunderclap Wyvern
card.ability: Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)\nFlying\nOther creatures you control with flying get +1/+1.
card.flavor: Thunder doesn't always mean rain. Sometimes it means ruin.

card.name: Timberpack Wolf
card.ability: Timberpack Wolf gets +1/+1 for each other creature you control named Timberpack Wolf.
card.flavor: Their strength is no mere numbers game. An intangible force augments the wolves when they run together.

card.name: Titanic Growth
card.ability: Target creature gets +4/+4 until end of turn.
card.flavor: The massive dominate through might. The tiny survive with guile. Beware the tiny who become massive.

card.name: Titan's Strength
card.ability: Target creature gets +3/+1 until end of turn. Scry 1. (Look at the top card of your library. You may put that card on the bottom of your library.)

card.name: Topan Freeblade
card.ability: Vigilance (Attacking doesn't cause this creature to tap.)\nRenown 1 (When this creature deals combat damage to a player, if it isn't renowned, put a +1/+1 counter on it and it becomes renowned.)
card.flavor: "My scars are my sigils. I will wear them with pride long after you're gone."

card.name: Tormented Thoughts
card.ability: As an additional cost to cast Tormented Thoughts, sacrifice a creature.\nTarget player discards a number of cards equal to the sacrificed creature's power.
card.flavor: "Not all nightmares can be escaped by waking."—Ashiok
card.ruling:
4/26/2014 : The targeted player will discard a number of cards equal to the power of the sacrificed creature as it last existed on the battlefield. 
4/26/2014 : You must sacrifice exactly one creature to cast this spell; you cannot cast it without sacrificing a creature, and you cannot sacrifice additional creatures. 
4/26/2014 : Players can only respond once this spell has been cast and all its costs have been paid. No one can try to destroy the creature you sacrificed to prevent you from casting this spell.

card.name: Totem-Guide Hartebeest
card.ability: When Totem-Guide Hartebeest enters the battlefield, you may search your library for an Aura card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.
card.flavor: It is hunted, but not for the kill. The magic within draws others to its presence.

card.name: Touch of Moonglove
card.ability: Target creature you control gets +1/+0 and gains deathtouch until end of turn. Whenever a creature dealt damage by that creature dies this turn, its controller loses 2 life. (Any amount of damage a creature with deathtouch deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)

card.name: Tower Geist
card.ability: Flying\nWhen Tower Geist enters the battlefield, look at the top two cards of your library. Put one of them into your hand and the other into your graveyard.
card.flavor: Jenrik's tower is served by those who once sought to enter it uninvited.
card.ruling: \n1/22/2011 : If there's only one card in your library when Tower Geist enters the battlefield, you'll look at that card and put it into your hand.

card.name: Tragic Arrogance
card.ability: For each player, you choose from among the permanents that player controls an artifact, a creature, an enchantment, and a planeswalker. Then each player sacrifices all other nonland permanents he or she controls.
card.flavor: The spear thrown by Kytheon's own hand was the weapon that felled his friends.

card.name: Turn to Frog
card.ability: Until end of turn, target creature loses all abilities and becomes a blue Frog with base power and toughness 1/1.
card.flavor: "Ribbit."
card.ruling:
7/18/2014 : The creature will lose all other colors and creature types, but it will retain any other card types (such as artifact) or supertypes (such as legendary) it may have. 
7/18/2014 : Turn to Frog overwrites all previous effects that set the creature’s base power and toughness to specific values. Any power- or toughness-setting effects that start to apply after Turn to Frog resolves will overwrite this effect. 
7/18/2014 : Turn to Frog doesn’t counter abilities that have already triggered or been activated. In particular, there is no way to cast this spell to stop a creature’s ability that says “At the beginning of your upkeep,” “When this creature enters the battlefield,” or similar from triggering. 
7/18/2014 : If the affected creature gains an ability after Turn to Frog resolves, it will keep that ability. 
7/18/2014 : Effects that modify a creature’s power and/or toughness, such as the effect of Titanic Growth, will apply to the creature no matter when they started to take effect. The same is true for any counters that change its power and/or toughness and effects that switch its power and toughness. 
7/18/2014 : If one of the Theros block Gods is affected by Turn to Frog, it will be a legendary 1/1 blue Frog enchantment creature with no abilities. If it stops being a creature, perhaps because your devotion to its color(s) decreased, it will be a legendary blue enchantment with no abilities. The way continuous effects work, the God’s type-changing ability is applied before the effect that removes that ability is applied.

card.name: Undead Servant
card.ability: When Undead Servant enters the battlefield, put a 2/2 black Zombie creature token onto the battlefield for each card named Undead Servant in your graveyard.
card.flavor: "Get up. You're not finished yet."—Liliana Vess

card.name: Undercity Troll
card.ability: Renown 1 (When this creature deals combat damage to a player, if it isn't renowned, put a +1/+1 counter on it and it becomes renowned.)\n{2}{G}: Regenerate Undercity Troll. (The next time this creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)

card.name: Unholy Hunger
card.ability: Destroy target creature.\nSpell mastery — If there are two or more instant and/or sorcery cards in your graveyard, you gain 2 life.
card.flavor: Liliana viewed the attention of the angels as a testament to her power. Even so, they were an annoyance.

card.name: Valeron Wardens
card.ability: Renown 2 (When this creature deals combat damage to a player, if it isn't renowned, put two +1/+1 counters on it and it becomes renowned.)\nWhenever a creature you control becomes renowned, draw a card.

card.name: Valor in Akros
card.ability: Whenever a creature enters the battlefield under your control, creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.
card.flavor: They became a single entity, a phalanx in the Temple of Triumph standing against a host of enemies.

card.name: Vastwood Gorger
card.flavor: "A long and difficult incision revealed that all vital organs are housed in the head, save for a long chain of stomachs, forty in all, leading from its throat to the end of the tail."—Mulak Ffar, Vastwood Biodiversity

card.name: Veteran's Sidearm
card.ability: Equipped creature gets +1/+1.\nEquip {1} ({1}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)
card.flavor: "I've broken three swords, eighteen lances, and countless shields, but this little blade has survived every battle, just like I have."

card.name: Vine Snare
card.ability: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn by creatures with power 4 or less.
card.flavor: Nissa found that the vines of the marsh could ensnare just as well as forest vines could—maybe even better.

card.name: Volcanic Rambler
card.ability: {2}{R}: Volcanic Rambler deals 1 damage to target player.
card.flavor: It moves through lava with the force of an erupting volcano.

card.name: Vryn Wingmare
card.ability: Flying\nNoncreature spells cost {1} more to cast.
card.flavor: It's the favored mount of military commanders as well as anyone with a flair for the dramatic.

card.name: War Horn
card.ability: Attacking creatures you control get +1/+0.
card.flavor: The reverberations course through the warriors' veins, beat with their hearts, and pound with their footfalls as they charge into battle.

card.name: War Oracle
card.ability: Lifelink (Damage dealt by this creature also causes you to gain that much life.)\nRenown 1 (When this creature deals combat damage to a player, if it isn't renowned, put a +1/+1 counter on it and it becomes renowned.)
card.flavor: "When you are felled by my mace, you shall know it was divine fate."

card.name: Watercourser
card.ability: {U}: Watercourser gets +1/-1 until end of turn.
card.flavor: "Beware an eddy where there should be none or a stretch that flows too fast or too slow."—Old Fishbones, Martyne river guide

card.name: Weight of the Underworld
card.ability: Enchant creature\nEnchanted creature gets -3/-2.
card.flavor: Proud Alkmenos, who would not bow to Erebos in death, is now bowed by his own hubris for all eternity.

card.name: Whirler Rogue
card.ability: When Whirler Rogue enters the battlefield, put two 1/1 colorless Thopter artifact creature tokens with flying onto the battlefield.\nTap two untapped artifacts you control: Target creature can't be blocked this turn.

card.name: Wild Instincts
card.ability: Target creature you control gets +2/+2 until end of turn. It fights target creature an opponent controls. (Each deals damage equal to its power to the other.)
card.flavor: Nissa had only the space of a heartbeat to react, her instincts steering her blade.

card.name: Willbreaker
card.ability: Whenever a creature an opponent controls becomes the target of a spell or ability you control, gain control of that creature for as long as you control Willbreaker.
card.flavor: "Master your mind, or I shall master it for you."

card.name: Woodland Bellower
card.ability: When Woodland Bellower enters the battlefield, you may search your library for a nonlegendary green creature card with converted mana cost 3 or less, put it onto the battlefield, then shuffle your library.

card.name: Yavimaya Coast
card.ability: {T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.\n{T}: Add {G} or {U} to your mana pool. Yavimaya Coast deals 1 damage to you.

card.name: Yeva's Forcemage
card.ability: When Yeva's Forcemage enters the battlefield, target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
card.flavor: "Nature can't be stopped. It rips and tears at Ravnica's tallest buildings to claim its place in the sun."
card.ruling: \n7/1/2012 : Yeva's Forcemage's ability is mandatory, although you can choose Yeva's Forcemage as the target.

card.name: Yoked Ox
card.flavor: It was in fields of grain, not fields of battle, that the Champion learned to bear the yoke of duty to the gods. She worked the land long before she was called on to defend it.—The Theriad

card.name: Zendikar Incarnate
card.ability: Zendikar Incarnate's power is equal to the number of lands you control.
card.flavor: "Her people angered Zendikar, and they faced the land's wrath. That is why Nissa is the last of the animists."—Numa, Joraga chieftain

card.name: Zendikar's Roil
card.ability: Whenever a land enters the battlefield under your control, put a 2/2 green Elemental creature token onto the battlefield.
card.flavor: "I was wrong. Zendikar isn't after me. It isn't after any of us. It's not evil or vengeful. It's magnificent . . . but it's in pain."—Nissa Revane
